Student Financial Aid and Scholarships     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Student Financial Aid and Scholarships      Student Financial Aid and Scholarships   Main Menu    Cost           Cost of Attendance (COA)    Estimating EFC    Financial Need    Paying Your Bill         Financial Aid Steps           Illinois RISE Act    Eligibility    Apply    Verification    Financial Aid Notification    Payment    Summer Financial Aid    SAP Policy & Appeal    Special Circumstances    Rights & Responsibilities    Withdrawing vs. Reducing Hours    FERPA    Calendar         Types of Aid           Grants    Scholarships    Waivers & Assistantships    Loans    Student Employment    Study Abroad    Veterans    Pre-paid Tuition         Forms           2019-2020 Forms    2020-2021 Forms         FAQ           Glossary of Terms    Contact Us         Consumer Information           Academic Programs    Department of Education Complaint Process    Financial Aid Information    Semester Withdrawals    General Institutional Information    Health, Safety and Security    Intercollegiate Athletic Program Participation Rates and Financial Support Data    Student Outcomes    Voter Registration    Notice of Availability of Institutional and Financial Aid Information    Contact Information for Assistance in Obtaining Institutional or Financial Aid Information          Eyebrow menu    Scholarships    UIC Connection    Student Affairs    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                      Pre-paid Tuition      View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Student Financial Aid and Scholarships    Types of Aid    Pre-paid Tuition        Pre-paid Tuition and 529 Plans  Illinois offers the College Illinois Prepaid Tuition Plan and the Bright Start College Savings Plan . The College Savings Plan Network allows you to obtain information on the plans available in other states. The value of any education savings plans should be included as other investments on the FAFSA form.  University Student Financial Services and Cashier Operations (USFSCO) processes the disbursement of College Illinois funds. The beneficiary should contact College Illinois directly for information regarding reimbursement of tuition-restricted scholarships or waivers. To learn about this process,Â please visit the USFSCO website .
